description: Set up Nx monorepo with proper workspace structure for Go backend and React frontend. Configure shared TypeScript types, OpenAPI SDK generation, and build pipelines.

phases.name: Nx Workspace Initialization
phases.description: Initialize the Nx workspace with proper directory structure and base configuration

subtasks.title: Initialize Nx workspace
subtasks.description: Create new Nx workspace with npm preset, configure apps/ and libs/ directories structure
subtasks.notes: Successfully created Nx workspace v22.3.3 with npm preset. Configured apps/ and libs/ directory structure with .gitkeep files. Created nx.json, package.json with nx dependencies (@nx/js, nx), and tsconfig.base.json with proper base configuration. All acceptance criteria met.

subtasks.title: Configure workspace settings
subtasks.description: Set up workspace-level TypeScript, ESLint, and Prettier configurations
subtasks.notes: Successfully configured workspace-level TypeScript, ESLint, and Prettier. Created .prettierrc with standard formatting rules (100 char line width, single quotes, trailing commas). Created .eslintrc.json with TypeScript and React support, extends prettier config to avoid conflicts. Added helpful npm scripts (format, format:check, lint, lint:fix). Installed necessary dependencies: prettier, eslint, @typescript-eslint/parser, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, eslint-config-prettier, eslint-plugin-react, eslint-plugin-react-hooks. tsconfig.base.json already has paths object ready for path aliases (to be populated in phase 4.3). All acceptance criteria met.

phases.name: React Frontend App Setup
phases.description: Scaffold the React frontend application with TanStack Router and Tailwind CSS

subtasks.title: Create React app under apps/web
subtasks.description: Generate React application with Vite bundler using Nx generators
subtasks.notes: Successfully generated React application with Vite bundler under apps/web. Installed @nx/react and @nx/vite plugins. Configured with Vitest for unit testing, TypeScript support, and proper Nx targets (build, serve, test). Vite config includes TypeScript paths plugin and asset copying. Server runs on port 4200, build outputs to dist/apps/web. Verified all acceptance criteria: apps/web directory exists, React app with Vite configuration (vite.config.mts), project.json with inferred targets from Vite config, nx serve web works, and nx build web produces correct output.

subtasks.title: Configure Tailwind CSS
subtasks.description: Add Tailwind CSS to the React app with proper PostCSS configuration
subtasks.notes: Successfully configured Tailwind CSS for the React app. Installed tailwindcss v4 with @tailwindcss/postcss plugin (required for Tailwind v4+), postcss, and autoprefixer. Created tailwind.config.js with proper content paths (index.html, src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}). Created postcss.config.js with @tailwindcss/postcss and autoprefixer plugins. Added Tailwind directives (@tailwind base, components, utilities) to apps/web/src/styles.css. Updated App component with Tailwind classes (min-h-screen, bg-gray-50) for verification. Verified all acceptance criteria: tailwind.config.js exists, postcss.config.js configured, Tailwind directives in global CSS, and Tailwind styles apply correctly (build succeeds, dev server starts, Tailwind classes appear in generated CSS).

subtasks.title: Add TanStack Router and Query
subtasks.description: Install and configure TanStack Router for routing and TanStack Query for data fetching
acceptance_criteria: Basic router setup with root route
subtasks.notes: Successfully installed and configured TanStack Router v1.145.7 and TanStack Query v5.90.16. Created basic router setup with root route (__root.tsx) and index route (index.tsx) in apps/web/src/routes/. Configured QueryClientProvider in main.tsx with sensible defaults (5min stale time, 1 retry). Created route tree configuration (routeTree.gen.ts) and router setup (router.tsx). Verified all acceptance criteria: build succeeds, dev server starts correctly on port 4200, router and query providers properly integrated. All acceptance criteria met.

phases.name: Go Backend App Setup
phases.description: Scaffold the Go backend application with Gin framework

subtasks.title: Create Go app structure under apps/api
subtasks.description: Set up Go module and directory structure for Gin-based API
subtasks.notes: Successfully created Go backend app structure under apps/api. Initialized go.mod with module github.com/vido/api and Go 1.23. Added Gin framework v1.10.0 and CORS middleware v1.7.2 as dependencies. Created cmd/api/main.go as the entry point with basic placeholder implementation. Created internal/ directory for private application packages (handlers, services, models to be added in subsequent subtasks). Added comprehensive README.md documenting the project structure and technology stack. All acceptance criteria met: apps/api directory exists, go.mod initialized, cmd/api/main.go entry point created, and internal/ directory for private packages created.

subtasks.title: Configure Gin server with basic routes
subtasks.description: Set up Gin HTTP server with health check endpoint
subtasks.notes: Successfully configured Gin HTTP server with health check endpoint. Created internal/handlers/health.go with HealthCheck handler that returns JSON response with status and service name. Updated cmd/api/main.go to set up Gin router with CORS middleware (configured for http://localhost:4200), registered /health endpoint, and made port configurable via PORT environment variable (defaults to 3000). Gin framework and CORS middleware were already installed in go.mod from subtask 3.1. Server uses gin.ReleaseMode by default and supports GIN_MODE environment variable for development mode. All acceptance criteria met: Gin framework installed, health check endpoint at /health, CORS middleware configured with proper origins/methods/headers, and server starts on configurable port.

subtasks.title: Create Nx targets for Go app
subtasks.description: Configure project.json with build, serve, and test targets for the Go application
subtasks.notes: Successfully created apps/api/project.json with Nx targets for the Go application. Configured build target (compiles to dist/apps/api/main), serve target (runs with GIN_MODE=debug for development), and test target (runs go test ./... -v). Added additional helpful targets: lint (go vet), fmt (go fmt), and tidy (go mod tidy). Generated go.sum file with all dependencies. Verified all acceptance criteria: apps/api/project.json exists, nx build api works (successfully builds 12M binary), nx serve api works (starts server correctly), and nx test api works (runs successfully, no test files yet). All targets use nx:run-commands executor with proper cwd configuration.

phases.name: Shared TypeScript Types Library
phases.description: Create shared TypeScript library for types used across frontend and generated from backend

subtasks.title: Create shared-types library
subtasks.description: Generate TypeScript library under libs/shared-types for shared type definitions
subtasks.notes: Successfully generated TypeScript library under libs/shared-types using Nx @nx/js:library generator with tsc bundler. Configured as publishable library with import path @vido/shared-types. Created project.json with build target using @nx/js:tsc executor, outputs to dist/libs/shared-types. Configured tsconfig.json with strict TypeScript settings and tsconfig.lib.json for compilation. Updated tsconfig.base.json with path alias mapping @vido/shared-types to libs/shared-types/src/index.ts. Created placeholder module structure in src/lib/shared-types.ts ready for type definitions in subsequent subtasks. Verified all acceptance criteria: libs/shared-types directory exists, project.json with build target configured, tsconfig.json properly configured, and library is exportable from @vido/shared-types. Build verified with nx build shared-types command.

subtasks.title: Define core data models
subtasks.description: Create TypeScript interfaces for Movie, Series, and API response types
subtasks.notes: Successfully created TypeScript interfaces for Movie, Series, and API response types. Created comprehensive Movie interface with properties for id, title, release date, genres, rating, overview, poster/backdrop paths, runtime, language, status, and external IDs (IMDb, TMDb). Created comprehensive Series interface with properties for id, title, air dates, genres, rating, overview, poster/backdrop paths, season/episode counts, status, language, external IDs, and production status. Created generic ApiResponse<T> interface for wrapping API responses with success, data, error, and message fields. Added bonus PaginatedApiResponse<T> interface extending ApiResponse for paginated data with page, totalPages, totalResults, and pageSize fields. All types are properly exported from index.ts. Build verified with 'nx build shared-types' command. TypeScript compilation succeeds with no errors. No console.log or debugging statements. All acceptance criteria met.

subtasks.title: Configure path aliases
subtasks.description: Set up TypeScript path aliases so apps can import from @vido/shared-types
subtasks.notes: Successfully verified TypeScript path aliases for @vido/shared-types. The path alias was already configured in tsconfig.base.json from subtask 4.1 (mapping @vido/shared-types to libs/shared-types/src/index.ts). Added example imports in apps/web/src/app/app.tsx using Movie and ApiResponse types to verify functionality. Confirmed all acceptance criteria: tsconfig.base.json has @vido/shared-types path, apps/web can import shared types, and no TypeScript errors on import (verified with nx build web, nx build shared-types, and tsc --noEmit). All builds succeeded with no errors.

subtasks.notes: Successfully verified nx build for all projects: shared-types (TypeScript), web (Vite/React), and api (Go). All builds complete successfully and outputs are correctly placed in dist/ directory. Verified both individual builds and parallel builds via nx run-many.

subtasks.title: Test nx serve/dev commands
subtasks.description: Verify that development servers start correctly for both apps
acceptance_criteria: nx serve web starts Vite dev server
nx serve api starts Go server
Hot reload works for web app
subtasks.notes: Successfully verified development servers for both apps. Web app (Vite dev server) starts correctly on port 4200 with React Fast Refresh enabled. API app (Gin server) starts correctly on port 3000 in debug mode with health endpoint functional. Both servers run concurrently without conflicts. Created comprehensive verification document (5.2-verification.md) documenting all test results. All acceptance criteria met: nx serve web starts Vite dev server, nx serve api starts Go server, both can run concurrently, and hot reload works for web app.

subtasks.notes: Successfully created comprehensive init.sh environment setup script. Script is executable and provides a smooth onboarding experience for new developers.
